column1: Santa Cruz del Norte is a town and municipality in the Mayabeque Province of Cuba. Before 2011 it was part of La Habana Province. It is located on the north shore
column2: between the cities of Havana and Matanzas
column3: at the mouth of the Santa Cruz River.

column2: being a fishing community at that time
column3: and achieved municipality status in 1931.This is the main home of the Havana Club rum distillery; all dark varieties being produced in Santa Cruz del Norte. The distillery can be visited as part of a tour.

column1: Other industries in the municipality include power generation
The municipality is divided into the consejos populares of Santa Cruz del Norte (the town proper) and the villages of Bacunayagua
column10: El Rubio and Paula.  A spur of the Hershey Electric Railway connects the town to Matanzas.  This is used mainly by diesel powered freight trains.

column2: the municipality of Santa Cruz del Norte had a population of 32
column3: 576. With a total area of 376 km2 (145 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 86.6/km2 (224/sq mi).
